intro: Ericameria gilmanii, commonly known as Gilman's ericameria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and open woodlands. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, resinous fruits. Ericameria gilmanii is often used in landscaping for its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
